intro: Stenomesson ruizianum, commonly known as the Ruiz's stenomesson, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Peru. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
